IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The mission of The Village Network is to promote responsible living and positive change in troubled children through partnerships with families and communities.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of The Village Network
IRS990.Description: SPECIALIZE IN THE TREATMENT AND CARE OF TROUBLED YOUTHS THROUGH INTEGRATED FOSTER CARE PROGRAMS. THE VILLAGE NETWORK WAS AWARDED SEVERAL COMPETITIVE PROGRAM GRANTS DURING THE YEAR. THESE INCLUDE TWO MULTI-DIMENSIONAL TREATMENT FOSTER CARE GRANTS WHICH REPLICATE THE FULL ARRAY OF TREATMENT INTERVENTIONS INTO SPECIALLY RECRUITED AND TRAINED FOSTER PARENT HOMES AND A NEIGHBOR-TO- NEIGHBOR GRANT PROVIDING SIBLING GROUP FOSTER CARE. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010 THE ORGANIZATION SERVED 594 YOUTHS (A 12.5% DECREASE OVER THE PRIOR YEAR) IN 247 DIFFERENT FOSTER CARE HOMES.

Activity2.Description: SPECIALIZE IN THE TREATMENT AND CARE OF TROUBLED YOUTHS THROUGH INTEGRATED RESIDENTIAL CARE PROGRAMS. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUN 30, 2010 THE ORGANIZATION SERVED 220 YOUTHS (A 3.3% INCREASE OVER THE PRIOR YEAR). IN OCTOBER 2008, THE ORGANIZATION BECAME THE FIRST OHIO AGENCY TO HAVE ITS SEXUALLY REACTIVE AND JUVENILE OFFENDER PROGRAMS CERTIFIED BY THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF YOUTH SERVICES.

Activity3.Description: SPECIALIZE IN THE TREATMENT AND CARE OF TROUBLED YOUTHS THROUGH INTEGRATED DAY TREATMENT AND COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS. THE VILLAGE NETWORK WAS AWARDED A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND JUVENILE JUSTICE GRANT FOR TREATMENT OF YOUTHFUL OFFENDERS IN THEIR HOMES WHO OTHERWISE WOULD BE INCARCERATED. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUN 30, 2010 THE ORGANIZATION SERVED 309 YOUTHS (A 26.4% DECREASE OVER THE PRIOR YEAR).

OtherAssets.Description: EMPLOYEE ONE WEEK PAYROLL ADVANCES TO CHANGE PAYROLL CYCLE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Endowment funds are held by the organization and used for

the specific purposes as designated by the original donor. The intended purposes of the fund are to support various types of client programming, help with long-term facility maintenance and improvement costs, and for client scholarships.
Direct fundraising expenses deducted from gross revenue

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board reviews and approves form 990 prior to filing.
Annual documentation of conflicts of interest required to be reported
and populated on related party transaction list that is
reviewed by the governing board and by management.
Compensation of top management and key emplyees is set
through comprehensive review of twelve different
criteria related to a given job position.
No documents are made available to the public.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Ensure Financial Sta- bility of Village Network
